What do I need to know to request an unlock in Verus?
To request an unlock in Verus, you need to know the current block height of the blockchain.

To request an unlock you need to know the blockheight of the blockchain. Under ``unlockatblock`` you can fill in whatever the current blockheight is minus 1. So if the blockheight is at 1,000,000 you can fill in ``999999`` or just ``0`` (recommended) to immediately request an unlock.

``` json
run setidentitytimelock "myid@" 
'{
  "unlockatblock":0
}'
```

You can copy and paste this code snippet into the commandline interface of Verus Desktop and edit the necessary inputs for your needs.
How do I specify the block height when requesting an unlock in Verus?
When requesting an unlock, you can specify the block height under "unlockatblock" by filling in the current block height minus 1. Alternatively, you can fill in 0 to immediately request an unlock.

To request an unlock you need to know the blockheight of the blockchain. Under ``unlockatblock`` you can fill in whatever the current blockheight is minus 1. So if the blockheight is at 1,000,000 you can fill in ``999999`` or just ``0`` (recommended) to immediately request an unlock.

``` json
run setidentitytimelock "myid@" 
'{
  "unlockatblock":0
}'
```

You can copy and paste this code snippet into the commandline interface of Verus Desktop and edit the necessary inputs for your needs.
How can I request an unlock in Verus using the command line interface?

You can request an unlock in Verus by running the `setidentitytimelock` command with the appropriate parameters. For example:
```
run setidentitytimelock "myid@" 
'{
  "unlockatblock":0
}'
```
This command requests an unlock for the identity "myid@" at the current block height (by setting "unlockatblock" to 0).

To request an unlock you need to know the blockheight of the blockchain. Under ``unlockatblock`` you can fill in whatever the current blockheight is minus 1. So if the blockheight is at 1,000,000 you can fill in ``999999`` or just ``0`` (recommended) to immediately request an unlock.

``` json
run setidentitytimelock "myid@" 
'{
  "unlockatblock":0
}'
```

You can copy and paste this code snippet into the commandline interface of Verus Desktop and edit the necessary inputs for your needs.
